history.content:
Hi There,

EE 227BT technically does have a 2-hour lab in its format which was approved by the Academic Senate. This lab is not taught formally and the old system was not able to notice we were out of compliance with the approved structure. The new system, however, is able to tell. In order to avoid the class conflict issue, 227BT's lab is not linked with the lecture and discussion, meaning you do not need to enroll in it. Since you are not enrolling in the lab, the conflict shouldn't be an issue. Prof. El Ghaoui will hopefully post something on the course website to explain this.

If this strategy doesn't work for some reason and you have to enroll in the lab, please let me know! lraya@berkeley.edu

children.subject:
Thanks for letting me know!

I'm going with Plan B: The lab is now linked, but scheduled for Friday at 6AM. This should not conflict with any class. Could you try again and let me know what happens? I'm not sure why the time was TBA since it was scheduled on my end before.

I tried adding the class to my enrollment shopping cart without the lab, but it won't let me: says that I must select a lab section, and I can't even select a lab section because it says that the lab section is still TBA (so as a result I can't add 227bt to my enrollment cart at all). Will this still be an issue come Telebears time?

history.content: Hi, so there is a 2hr lab section scheduled for EE 227bt next semester, while there has not been a lab section historically in past semester's. Are labs a new development for next semester or is the scheduled lab section a mistake? I'm asking since the addition of this lab section causes a conflict with another class lecture, meaning I can't sign up for both anymore under the new system. Thanks!
history.subject: EE 227bt lab section?
